info.name: Personal Website API
info.description:
API collection for the Personal Website backend. Set the `baseUrl` variable to match your environment.

Active endpoints: Operations (health, encrypt, decrypt) and Projects (CRUD + filter by technology).

Technology CRUD endpoints are pending controller implementation — sample request bodies are in `docs/api/sample-requests/technologies/`.

variable.description: Base URL for all API requests. Change for staging/production.
Project ID used in single-resource endpoints. Update after creating a project.
Technology name for the filter-by-technology endpoint.

request.description: Returns service health status including version and active environment.
Encrypts plaintext into an ENC(...) wrapped value suitable for use in Spring property files. Not available in production.
Decrypts an ENC(...) wrapped ciphertext back to plaintext. Accepts input with or without the ENC() wrapper. Not available in production.
Retrieve all projects. No pagination — returns the full list.
Retrieve projects with Spring Data pagination. Adjust page, size, and sort query params as needed.
Retrieve a single project by its ID. Returns 404 if not found.

request.description: Create a new project. `name` and `shortDescription` are required. `type` is required (PERSONAL, PROFESSIONAL, OPEN_SOURCE, LEARNING, FREELANCE). Slug is auto-generated from name if omitted. To associate technologies, provide `technologyIds` once technologies exist.

request.description: Update an existing project. Same required fields as create. Published projects cannot be deleted — archive them instead.
Delete a project by ID. Published projects cannot be deleted — set status to ARCHIVED first.
Filter projects by technology name. Case-insensitive search. Update the `technology` collection variable to change the filter value.
